description: Borrowed from Italian gondola, from Venetian góndoƚa, from Byzantine Greek κοντούρα (kontoúra, “cutter, kind of ship”).

entries.meaning: A small long, narrow boat with a high prow and stern, propelled with a single oar, especially in Venice.

definitionGroups.group: A hanging platform or car for transporting people or cargo.

entries.meaning: An enclosed car attached to a cable mechanically lifted up the side of a mountain; an enclosed ski lift; a cable car.
The car or basket of a hot-air balloon, airship, zeppelin, etc.
The hanging cart in which a glass-cleaning worker stands to clean exterior glass on tall buildings.
That part of a transporter bridge that carries passengers, vehicles, along the length of the bridge span.
(rail transport, US) A type of open railway car with low sides, used to carry heavy freight such as crushed rock or steel.
A free-standing shelving unit in a supermarket or other retail store.

verbs.description: gondola (third-person singular simple present gondolas, present participle gondolaing, simple past and past participle gondolaed)
